text: have the same problem as others regarding setting this up all from absolutely no directions on how to properly use this product from phillips whoever wrote the phillips software never actually had to use it so here it is once you have the hue bridge and lights discovered by alexa it will show devices discovered some of these devices will be the actual lights other listed will actually be groups precreated and not specific devices when you try to first use alexa to turn off and on the lights it will not recognize the commands because it does not recognize a group name what you need to do is delete or forget the groups it found and create your own groups within the alexa app it is easier to use a web browser on a computer to do all this create your own group and name it living room for example and manually add or select the lights you have in your living room to add them to the group alexa will now recognize the command alexa turn off living room because you will be telling alexa to turn off the group you just created

text: I have been using this skill out of necessity for quite a while although I will run into an occasional glitch they are not too frequent some users have reported problems getting the app to understand what station they are asking for based on trial and error I have found that its usually best to just say alexa play knx or whatever stations call letters you are looking for keep it simple another complaint I have seen is about the frequency and length of commercial breaks actually the app fits commercials into the same timeslots as the radio station itself uses in other words it overrides the local commercials with its own content some of the commercial breaks are composed of national ads usually these are coming directly from audacy they will often repeat the same commercials backtoback this actually does not take up additional time but it is really monotonous and annoying then there are a few breaks from timetotime where audacy allows the local station to run their own ads usually sold to their clients specifically for online play so in most cases the only extra advertising versus the stations normal advertising breaks occurs when you first launch the app basically it forces you to listen to a commercial that is inserted before the station begins to streamso overall my feeling is if you can find the station you want from a different source you might be better off but unfortunately audacy controls online access for all of the stations they own well over 200 priily anything associated with cbs and of course they also have some specialty nonbroadcast stations they have created exclusively for the app
label: promotion

text: update now the streaming service has stopped working altogether through alexa how in the world does this company stay in businesswhen you first ask alexa to call up siriusxm the service plays up to three minutes of commercials before you can hear any programming that is already an insult considering that you are already paying for siriusxm then sometimes you get more commercials if you change channels if you do not have the service playing everywhere and move from one room device to another you get to listen to yet more commercials when you start the skill in the next roomand finally the most irritating offense siriusxm periodically interrupts programming to play additional commercials i do not mean you get commercials at the regular commercial breaks i mean that you might be listening to an interview on cnn or fox news and suddenly the service will cut to commercials in the middle of someone speaking so that you do not hear the rest of the interview when the feed resumes you also get to enjoy all the regular commercial breaks in addition to these bonus commercialsso overall use this skill if you like listening to a ridiculous number of commercials on a service you already pay for or you can always just go listen in your car for scratchy and dropped reception every time you pass a tmobile tower
